Package org.jtrim2.executor

Class CancelableTasks

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.executor.CancelableTasks
public final class CancelableTasks extends Object
Defines static methods to return simple, convenient cancelable task related instances.

This class cannot be inherited nor instantiated.

Thread safety

Methods of this class are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

Methods of this class are synchronization transparent.

  • Method Details

    • toAsync

      public static <R> AsyncFunction<R> toAsync(TaskExecutor executor, CancelableFunction<? extends R> function)
      Returns an asynchronous task executing the given synchronous task on the given executor. That is, the returned asynchronous task will simply submit the given task to the given executor.
      Type Parameters:
      R - the type of the result of the computation
      Parameters:
      executor - the executor on which the given synchronous task is executed. This argument cannot be null.
      function - the synchronous task doing the computation. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the asynchronous task executing the given synchronous task on the given executor. This method never returns null.

    • noOpCancelableTask

      public static CancelableTask noOpCancelableTask()
      Returns a CancelableTask whose execute method does nothing but returns immediately to the caller.
      Returns:
      a CancelableTask whose execute method does nothing but returns immediately to the caller. This method never returns null.

    • runOnceCancelableTask

      public static CancelableTask runOnceCancelableTask(CancelableTask task)
      Returns a CancelableTask which will execute the specified CancelableTask (forwarding the arguments passed to it) but will execute the specified CancelableTask only once. The specified task will not be executed more than once even if it is called multiple times concurrently (and is allowed to be called concurrently).

      Calling the execute method of the returned Runnable multiple times will only result in a single execution and every other call (not actually executing the specified CancelableTask) will silently return without doing anything.

      Parameters:
      task - the CancelableTask to which calls are to be forwarded by the returned CancelableTask. This method cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the CancelableTask which will execute the specified CancelableTask but will execute the specified CancelableTask only once. This method never returns null.

    • runOnceCancelableTaskStrict

      public static CancelableTask runOnceCancelableTaskStrict(CancelableTask task)
      Returns a CancelableTask which will execute the specified CancelableTask (forwarding the arguments passed to it) but will execute the specified CancelableTask only once, failing on multiple execute attempts. The specified task will not be executed more than once even if it is called multiple times concurrently (and is allowed to be called concurrently).

      Attempting to call the run method of the returned Runnable multiple times will cause an IllegalStateException to be thrown after the first attempt.

      Parameters:
      task - the CancelableTask to which calls are to be forwarded by the returned CancelableTask. This method cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the CancelableTask which will execute the specified CancelableTask but will execute the specified CancelableTask only once. This method never returns null.

    • canceledComplationStage

      public static <T> CompletionStage<T> canceledComplationStage()
      Returns a CompletionStage which was already completed exceptionally with an OperationCanceledException.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the result of the CompletionStage
      Returns:
      a CompletionStage which was already completed exceptionally with an OperationCanceledException. This method never returns null.
